result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond A. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond A. Garcia is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond A. Garcia was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond A. Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Put over  to 12-5 for reveiw with 16cm283 - defendant may get on payment plan

Defendant Raymond A. Garcia in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:21
Calling 15cm192,156cm239,16cm224 (reviews of fines) and 16cm208,16cm283and 16cm220  
In receipt of 16cm283 - waive reading - not guilty plea entered 
Bail continued
Defendant has made payments and will make another $100 today - 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Judge O'Melia will allow the warrants quashed upon receipt of $100.00.  Future review hearing will be set at that time.    15CM239 & 15CM192
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
Mr. Garcia will be mailing $50.00 payment.  Explained that will grant him a 30 day extension as this is the first payment on these fines.    15CM239 & 15CM192

11:03 a.m. Defendant Raymond A. Garcia in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm239, 15tr1470,15tr1471, 15tr69 and 15cm192. Plea questionaire filed. In 15cm192 - State moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct - ordinance violation - Granted. In 15cm239 State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted.  State moves to dismiss 15tr1469, 15tr1470 and 15tr1471 - Granted. Schiek states victim rights have been complied with. Defendant enters no contest pleas.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. In 15cm192 - Court imposes fine of $330.50 (includes costs).  In 15cm239  - Court imposes fine of $579 (includes costs). Hogan requests additional time for defendant to pay fines.  Review hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm. Adj. 11:11 a.m.

1:35 p.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM192, 15CM239, 15TR1471, 15TR1470 and 15TR1469. Hogan states defendant is in custody in Winnebago County - on probation in Oneida County and will be returned to Oneida County. Hogan requests jury trial in 15cm192. Status conferences scheduled for same date as jury trial in remaining cases. Bail continued. Adj. 1:40 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:39 pm - Defendant Raymond A. Garcia in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Raymond A. Garcia in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Calling 15tr1469-1471 and 15cm192.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Bednar/Hogan to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
